content: 1 The elder to the beloved Gaius, whom I love in truth.
content_old: 1 The elder to the beloved Gaius, whom I love in truth.

content: 2 Beloved, I desire that in all things thou shouldest prosper and be in health, even as thy soul prospers.
content_old: 2 Beloved, I desire that in all things thou shouldest prosper and be in health, even as thy soul prospers.

content: 3 For I rejoiced exceedingly when the brethren came and bore testimony to thy holding fast the truth, even as thou walkest in truth.
content_old: 3 For I rejoiced exceedingly when the brethren came and bore testimony to thy holding fast the truth, even as thou walkest in truth.

content: 4 I have no greater joy than these things that I hear of my children walking in the truth.
content_old: 4 I have no greater joy than these things that I hear of my children walking in the truth.

content: 5 Beloved, thou doest faithfully in whatever thou mayest have wrought towards the brethren and that strangers,
content_old: 5 Beloved, thou doest faithfully in whatever thou mayest have wrought towards the brethren and that strangers,

content: 6 (who have witnessed of thy love before the assembly,) in setting forward whom on their journey worthily of God, thou wilt do well;
content_old: 6 (who have witnessed of thy love before the assembly,) in setting forward whom on their journey worthily of God, thou wilt do well;

content: 7 for for the name have they gone forth, taking nothing of those of the nations.
content_old: 7 for for the name have they gone forth, taking nothing of those of the nations.

content: 8 We therefore ought to receive such, that we may be fellow-workers with the truth.
content_old: 8 We therefore ought to receive such, that we may be fellow-workers with the truth.

content: 9 I wrote something to the assembly; but Diotrephes, who loves to have the first place among them, receives us not.
content_old: 9 I wrote something to the assembly; but Diotrephes, who loves to have the first place among them, receives us not.

content: 10 For this reason, if I come, I will bring to remembrance his works which he does, babbling against us with wicked words; and not content with these, neither does he himself receive the brethren; and those who would he prevents, and casts them out of the assembly.
content_old: 10 For this reason, if I come, I will bring to remembrance his works which he does, babbling against us with wicked words; and not content with these, neither does he himself receive the brethren; and those who would he prevents, and casts them out of the assembly.

content: 11 Beloved, do not imitate what is evil, but what is good. He that does good is of God. He that does evil has not seen God.
content_old: 11 Beloved, do not imitate what is evil, but what is good. He that does good is of God. He that does evil has not seen God.

content: 12 Demetrius has witness borne to him by all, and by the truth itself; and we also bear witness, and thou knowest that our witness is true.
content_old: 12 Demetrius has witness borne to him by all, and by the truth itself; and we also bear witness, and thou knowest that our witness is true.

content: 13 I had many things to write to thee, but I will not with ink and pen write to thee;
content_old: 13 I had many things to write to thee, but I will not with ink and pen write to thee;
